subject: Learning
title: Calibration: How Accurate Is Your Self-Assessment?
description: Learn Calibration: How Accurate Is Your Self-Assessment? in one minute.

hook.text: Students who predict they'll score 85% but actually score 65% are poorly calibrated. Most students are.

buildup.text: Calibration measures the gap between your confidence in your knowledge and your actual performance.

discovery.text: Well-calibrated learners study efficiently because they focus effort where it's actually needed.

twist.text: Overconfidence is the default. People consistently overestimate what they know, especially in familiar domains.

climax.text: Practice testing is the best calibration toolâ€”it reveals gaps that rereading hides.

punchline.text: You can't fix what you can't see. Calibrate first, then study.

quiz.question: What is calibration in metacognition?
options: The match between confidence in your knowledge and actual performance
The speed at which you can recall information
How many hours you spend studying
